special_cp.overview: Silvally (Normal)'s has 3336 max CP (at Level 50). A Silvally (Normal) obtained from Raids can be encountered from 1609 CP to 1686 CP, or if weather boosted, in the 2011 CP to 2107 CP range. In Field and Special Research, Silvally (Normal) can be found in the 1207 CP to 1264 CP range.
more_info: Field and Special Research encounters are always Level 15. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Field Research encounters have a 10/10/10 IV floor.
Pok√©mon hatched from Eggs are always Level 20. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Egg Hatches have a 10/10/10 IV floor.
Raid Bosses caught without weather boost are always Level 20. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Raid Catches have a 10/10/10 IV floor. üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.
üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.

Raid Bosses caught with weather boost are always Level 25. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Weather boosted Raid Catches have a 10/10/10 IV floor. üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.
üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.
Wild encounters range from Level 1 to Level 30 Pok√©mon. Their IVs range from 0 (min) to 15 (max) for each stat.

Weather Boosted wild Pok√©mon encounters get a 5 Level boost, bringing their Level range to Level 6 to Level 35. In addition, they have a guaraneed minimum IV value of 4 for each stat, resulting in a 4/4/4 IV floor.

mega_boost.title: Mega Pok√©mon that boost Silvally (Normal)
mega_boost.intro_text: A list of Mega Pok√©mon that boost Silvally (Normal)'s Normal-type moves, Candy, and Candy XL from catching Silvally (Normal).

bonus_info.raid_bonus: Mega and Primal Raid Bonus ‚Äì Mega Pok√©mon boost the attack power of all other Pok√©mon when battling in Raid Battles by 10%. Attacks that share their type with the Mega Pok√©mon's type(s) receive a 30% boost. However, these bonuses do not stack if there are multiple Mega-Evolved Pok√©mon battling simultaneously; only the higher boost will be applied.
bonus_info.catch_bonus: Mega and Primal Catch Bonus ‚Äì While a Pok√©mon is Mega-Evolved, additional XP and Candy is granted when catching a Pok√©mon that shares a type with it, or for any raid boss caught. These do not stack with each other. Additionally, High and Max Level Mega-Evolved Pok√©mon grant an increased chance to obtain Candy XL when catching a Pok√©mon that shares a type with it.

size_info.description: Silvally (Normal)'s height ranges from 1.13 m to 3.57 m, with the average being 2.3 m. The illustration shows a comparison with a 1.70 m (5‚Ä≤07‚Ä≥) tall Trainer. Max height has been limited to 450px for rendering purposes.

pokedex.entry: Its trust in its partner is what awakens it. This Pok√©mon is capable of changing its type, a flexibility that is well displayed in battle.
Although its name was Type: Null at first, the boy who evolved it into this form gave it the name by which it is now known.
This is its form once it has awakened and evolved. Freed from its heavy mask, its speed is greatly increased.
Through the bond it formed with its Trainer, its will was strengthened, and it was able to destroy its control mask.
A solid bond of trust between this Pok√©mon and its Trainer awakened the strength hidden within Silvally. It can change its type at will.
The final factor needed to release this Pok√©mon‚Äôs true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

faq.question: What are Silvally (Normal)‚Äôs strengths and weaknesses?
faq.answer: As a Normal-type Pok√©mon, Silvally (Normal) is weak to Fighting-type moves.

faq.answer: The best moves for Silvally (Normal) in Pok√©mon GO are Tackle and Tri Attack. This moveset has a DPS (Damage Per Second) of 10.526 and a TDO (Total Damage Output) of 241.405.
